thread.title: Will Smith is getting jiggy with music again with Latin band

title: Will Smith is getting jiggy with music again with Latin band
text:
Will Smith is getting jiggy with music again with Latin band Will Smith is getting jiggy with music again with Latin band Share 
Will Smith has turned his hand to music again ‚Äì and is embracing some Latin rhythms. 
The Grammy-winning rapper and Oscar-nominated actor appears on a remix of Colombian band Bomba Estereo‚Äôs song, Fiesta. 
The collaboration marks the Fresh Prince‚Äôs first return to music since his 2005 album Lost And Found. Happy birthday from Colombia, dear #WillSmith ! üá®üá¥üòò pic.twitter.com/1xxyGzzQmT 
‚Äî Bomba Est√©reo (@bombaestereo) September 25, 2015 
Suicide Squad star Will discovered Bomba Estereo, known for its blend of Latin, tropical and electro sounds, on a recent trip to Colombia and asked the group to collaborate. 
‚ÄúWhen I was told that Will Smith wanted to collaborate on a remix with Bomba, I couldn‚Äôt believe it,‚Äù band founder and multi-instrumentalist Simon Mejia said in a statement. ‚ÄúThis opportunity to work with Will was beyond anything we have dreamed of ‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs just magic.‚Äù 
Will raps in both English and Spanish on the song. He recently shot a music video for the remix with Bomba Estereo. Simon Mejia and Liliana Saumet of Bomba Estereo (Ivan Pierre Aguirre/AP) 
Fiesta is nominated for record of the year at next month‚Äôs Latin Grammy Awards, while Bomba Estereo‚Äôs album Amanecer is up for best alternative music album. 
When the nominees were announced last month, Will posted a selfie with the quartet on his Facebook page and wrote: ‚ÄúFelicidades to BOMBA ESTEREO on their Latin Grammy Nominations!‚Äù 
Bomba Estereo also includes singer Liliana Saumet, drummer Andres Zea and multi-instrumentalist Julian Salazar. They formed in 2005 and have performed at major music festivals, including Coachella, Glastonbury and Lollapalooza. DJ Jazzy Jeff and the Fresh Prince (Lennox McLendon/AP) 
Will‚Äôs solo songs include Gettin‚Äô Jiggy Wit It, Miami and Wild Wild West, while he has had hits as the Fresh Prince, alongside DJ Jazzy Jeff, with Summertime and Boom Shake The Room. Share article 
The 16th annual Latin Grammys will take place on November 19 at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas. Promoted Stories
